meanings.definition: The area of land that is washed by the sea or other body of water.
meanings.sent1: The landwash along the coast was covered in seashells.
meanings.sent2: The waves gently kissed the landwash, leaving behind foam.
meanings.sent3: The crabs had a beach party on the landwash, dancing in the sand.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the landwash in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The landwash sparkled under the moonlight, like a bed of diamonds.

meanings.definition: To wash or be washed by the sea or other body of water.
meanings.sent1: The ship will landwash on the shore after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The debris from the shipwreck will landwash onto the beach.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls love to watch the waves landwash the shore.
meanings.sent4: Memories landwash in and out like the tides of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The river landwashes the rocks, smoothing them over time.
